construction, Lp spaces

  1. Show that ℓ∞(Z)\ell^\infty\p{\Z}ℓ∞(Z) contains continuum many functions xα ⁣:Z→R\func{x_\alpha}{\Z}{\R}xα​:Z→R obeying

    ∥xα∥ℓ∞=1and∥xα−xβ∥ℓ∞≥1whenever α≠β.\norm{x_\alpha}_{\ell^\infty} = 1 \quad\text{and}\quad \norm{x_\alpha - x_\beta}_{\ell^\infty} \geq 1 \quad\text{whenever } \alpha \neq \beta.∥xα​∥ℓ∞​=1and∥xα​−xβ​∥ℓ∞​≥1whenever α=β.

  2. Deduce (assuming the axiom of choice) that the Banach space dual of ℓ∞(Z)\ell^\infty\p{\Z}ℓ∞(Z) cannot contain a countable dense subset.

  3. Deduce that ℓ1(Z)\ell^1\p{\Z}ℓ1(Z) is not reflexive.
Solution.

  1. Consider

    A={x∣x(n)∈{0,1}}∖{0}A = \set{x \mid x\p{n} \in \set{0, 1}} \setminus \set{0}A={x∣x(n)∈{0,1}}∖{0}

    i.e., the set of binary strings excluding the zero string. This is uncountable: if that were not the case, then there exists a bijection A→ZA \to \ZA→Z, which we denote A={xk}k∈ZA = \set{x_k}_{k\in\Z}A={xk​}k∈Z​. But consider x(n)=1−xn(n)x\p{n} = 1 - x_n\p{n}x(n)=1−xn​(n) for n∈Zn \in \Zn∈Z, i.e., at each n∈Zn \in \Zn∈Z, x(n)≠xn(n)x\p{n} \neq x_n\p{n}x(n)=xn​(n) and x∈Ax \in Ax∈A. By construction, x∈Ax \in Ax∈A and by assumption, A={xk}k∈ZA = \set{x_k}_{k\in\Z}A={xk​}k∈Z​, so there exists k∈Zk \in \Zk∈Z such that x=xkx = x_kx=xk​. But x(k)≠xk(k)x\p{k} \neq x_k\p{k}x(k)=xk​(k), so x≠xkx \neq x_kx=xk​, a contradiction. Hence, AAA must be uncountable.

    By construction, for any x∈Ax \in Ax∈A, there exists n∈Zn \in \Zn∈Z such that x(n)=1x\p{n} = 1x(n)=1. Since ∣x(n)∣≤1\abs{x\p{n}} \leq 1∣x(n)∣≤1 for all n∈Zn \in \Zn∈Z, this means ∥x∥ℓ∞\norm{x}_{\ell^\infty}∥x∥ℓ∞​. Similarly, for xα,xβ∈Ax_\alpha, x_\beta \in Axα​,xβ​∈A with α≠β\alpha \neq \betaα=β, then xα≠xβx_\alpha \neq x_\betaxα​=xβ​, so there exists n∈Zn \in \Zn∈Z with xα(n)≠xβ(n)x_\alpha\p{n} \neq x_\beta\p{n}xα​(n)=xβ​(n). By construction, ∣xα(n)−xβ(n)∣=1\abs{x_\alpha\p{n} - x_\beta\p{n}} = 1∣xα​(n)−xβ​(n)∣=1 and so ∣xα−xβ∣\abs{x_\alpha - x_\beta}∣xα​−xβ​∣ attains its maximum, i.e., ∥xα−xβ∥ℓ∞=1\norm{x_\alpha - x_\beta}_{\ell^\infty} = 1∥xα​−xβ​∥ℓ∞​=1.

  2. Let {xα}α∈A\set{x_\alpha}_{\alpha \in A}{xα​}α∈A​ be the uncountable subset we constructed in (1) and suppose {yn}n\set{y_n}_n{yn​}n​ is a countable dense subset. Then for any α∈A\alpha \in Aα∈A, there exists nα∈Nn_\alpha \in \Nnα​∈N such that ∥xα−ynα∥ℓ∞≤14\norm{x_\alpha - y_{n_\alpha}}_{\ell^\infty} \leq \frac{1}{4}∥xα​−ynα​​∥ℓ∞​≤41​, by the axiom of choice,

    Notice that if α≠β\alpha \neq \betaα=β, then

    1≤∥xα−xβ∥ℓ∞≤∥xα−ynα∥ℓ∞+∥ynα−ynβ∥ℓ∞+∥ynβ−xβ∥ℓ∞≤12+∥ynα−ynβ∥ℓ∞  ⟹  12≤∥ynα−ynβ∥ℓ∞.\begin{aligned} 1 &\leq \norm{x_\alpha - x_\beta}_{\ell^\infty} \\ &\leq \norm{x_\alpha - y_{n_\alpha}}_{\ell^\infty} + \norm{y_{n_\alpha} - y_{n_\beta}}_{\ell^\infty} + \norm{y_{n_\beta} - x_\beta}_{\ell^\infty} \\ &\leq \frac{1}{2} + \norm{y_{n_\alpha} - y_{n_\beta}}_{\ell^\infty} \\ \implies \frac{1}{2} &\leq \norm{y_{n_\alpha} - y_{n_\beta}}_{\ell^\infty}. \end{aligned}1⟹21​​≤∥xα​−xβ​∥ℓ∞​≤∥xα​−ynα​​∥ℓ∞​+∥∥​ynα​​−ynβ​​∥∥​ℓ∞​+∥∥​ynβ​​−xβ​∥∥​ℓ∞​≤21​+∥∥​ynα​​−ynβ​​∥∥​ℓ∞​≤∥∥​ynα​​−ynβ​​∥∥​ℓ∞​.​

    Thus, ynα≠ynβy_{n_\alpha} \neq y_{n_\beta}ynα​​=ynβ​​, so the mapping A∋α↦nαA \ni \alpha \mapsto n_\alphaA∋α↦nα​ is injective. But this is impossible, since this implies that AAA is at most countable, so no dense subset could have existed to begin with.

  3. We know that in a Banach space, if X∗X^*X∗ is separable, then so is XXX (see Spring 2011 - Problem 5). Thus, if ℓ1(Z)\ell^1\p{\Z}ℓ1(Z) were reflexive, we would have

    (ℓ∞(Z))∗≃ℓ1(Z),\p{\ell^\infty\p{\Z}}^* \simeq \ell^1\p{\Z},(ℓ∞(Z))∗≃ℓ1(Z),

    and ℓ1(Z)\ell^1\p{\Z}ℓ1(Z) is separable, e.g., via

    {∑k=1nqnekn | n∈N, qn∈Q, kn∈Z}\set{\sum_{k=1}^n q_ne_{k_n} \st n \in \N,\ q_n \in \Q,\ k_n \in \Z}{k=1∑n​qn​ekn​​∣∣​n∈N, qn​∈Q, kn​∈Z}

    where en(k)=1e_n\p{k} = 1en​(k)=1 if k=nk = nk=n and 000 otherwise. But this implies that ℓ∞(Z)\ell^\infty\p{\Z}ℓ∞(Z) is also separable, which we established is impossible in (2). Thus, ℓ1(Z)\ell^1\p{\Z}ℓ1(Z) is not reflexive, which completes the proof.
